posts.title: Creating Personal Blog Using Github + Hexo
posts.excerpt: A brief guideline of creating a personal website. This guideline includes the solutions to some common errors.
posts.text: A brief guideline of creating a personal website. This guideline includes the solutions to some common errors. IntroThis is my first blog :) In this article, I will record my process of creating a personal blogusing Github and Hexo. This approach could be used to create any websites, not just blog. I will also discuss about some problems I met with and the solutions I used during this process, which might be helpful for somebody who visits this website. Hope you enjoy the charm of creation. Outline Github Hexo (Node.js, Git) Website Creation Markdown Github Github Pages is a static site hosting service designed to host your personal, organization, or project pages directly from a Github repository. If you don’t have a Github account, create one here! We need it to build our website. HexoWhat is Hexo? Hexo is a fast, simple and powerful blog framework; it’s also a static site generator. Click hexo website to get more information. InstallationWe’ll use Hexo to help us create our personal website. Click here to watch the video. Or, just follow the steps below. We need to install a couple of things first. 1. Install Node.jsClick DownLoad_Nodejs to download Node.js. Or choose one of the links below. Windows Installer 32-bit Windows Installer 64-bit 2. Install GitClick git to download. Mac: See instruction in the hexo website.
